record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, APRIL 14, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, APRIL 14, 2008 -- (Senate - April 10, 2008)

[Page: S2954]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m., Monday, April 14; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for use later in the day, the Senate proceed to a period of morning business until 3 p.m., with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each; and that following morning business, the Senate resume the motion to proceed to Calendar No. 608, H.R. 1195, the highway technical corrections bill.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
